definition.name: drv.domain.dns.name
definition.description:
xlfid(NOVLADDCFG.idmresource.NOVLADDCFGSynchronizationPrompts.gcv.dscr.drv.domain.dns.name)Specify the DNS name of the Active Directory domain managed by this driver.
For example: domain.com

definition.name: drv.subPlacementType
definition.description: xlfid(NOVLADDCFG.idmresource.NOVLADDCFGSynchronizationPrompts.gcv.dscr.drv.subPlacementType)Specify the desired form of placement for the Subscriber channel. Select Flat to place objects strictly within the base container. Select Mirrored to place objects hierarchically within the base container. This is used to determine the Subscriber channel Placement policies.

definition.name: drv.user.container
definition.description: xlfid(NOVLADDCFG.idmresource.NOVLADDCFGSynchronizationPrompts.gcv.dscr.drv.user.container)Specify the container where user objects reside in Active Directory. Typically the container is CN=Users,DC=domain,DC=company,DC=com, but if a custom container is created, the path could be OU=custom,DC=domain,DC=company,DC=com. If you are using a flat Placement rule, this is the container where the users are placed. If you are using a mirrored Placement rule, this is the root container.

definition.name: drv.pubPlacementType
definition.description: xlfid(NOVLADDCFG.idmresource.NOVLADDCFGSynchronizationPrompts.gcv.dscr.drv.pubPlacementType)Specify the desired form of placement for the Publisher channel. Select Flat to place objects strictly within the base container. Select Mirrored to place objects hierarchically within the base container. This is used to determine the Publisher channel Placement policies.
